proposals.reasoning: There’s a broad soft consensus around an Alice + Diana core as a calm, low-pressure start. For the third slot, Henry has been supportive of that core without aggressively pushing to be on the team, and multiple players (Diana, Frank, Grace, Henry himself) have floated Henry as a reasonable inclusion. Choosing Henry over Grace avoids leaning too hard into a single ‘obvious’ trio that many people named (Alice, Diana, Grace), which helps keep flexibility and reduces the risk of everyone auto-clearing a fixed set too early. This team aligns with the table’s general preferences while minimizing early over-commitment and obvious self-camping behavior.

votes.comment: Early mission with no hard info; team matches broad consensus, includes me, avoids over-committing to a single ‘trusted trio’ while keeping picks low-pressure and non-pushy.
Solid low-info Mission 1 team with broad consensus around Alice+Diana; Henry is a reasonable third and there’s no strong reason to disrupt this early.
Henry is evil and on the team, so this lineup gives us an early chance to sabotage while still looking aligned with the soft consensus.
No obvious reason to distrust this lineup on Mission 1 and it avoids anyone who’s been pushing too hard, so it’s a reasonable low-risk starting team.
Mission 1 with a broadly agreed Alice+Diana core and a non-controversial third (Henry) is fine; we need an early mission to generate info and there are no strong red flags yet.
Includes an ally while appearing to follow the table’s consensus for a safe, low‑pressure first team.
Fits the broad consensus for a low-risk first mission with no major red flags; good for gathering initial info.
I’m on the team and it matches the broadly supported Alice+Diana core, so there’s no reason for me to oppose it.

discussion.content: Since it’s only the first mission and we have no info yet, I’d rather start with a simple, low‑risk team—something like me plus two people who’ve been acting calm and consistent so far. If anyone’s pushing *too* hard to be on this first team, I’m a bit wary of them.

Early on I like having at least one quieter, low‑pressure player and one strong voice, so I’d be fine with something like you, Diana, and one of the rest of us who hasn’t been angling hard to be included. If anyone suddenly insists “I *have* to* be on this first team,” I’m going to side‑eye that pretty hard.

I’m okay keeping it pretty low-key for Mission 1—Alice plus two people who aren’t loudly campaigning feels safest, and I’d lean toward including someone like Diana and one of Bob/Grace rather than anyone really pushing to be on.

I’m fine with a low‑info start, so something like Alice, me, and one of Grace or Henry feels reasonable—nobody’s pinging me hard yet, but I’d slightly rather avoid anyone who seems too eager to shape the first team.

I’m okay starting with something like Alice, Diana, and Grace, since there’s a broad soft consensus there, but I’d really like us to rotate in some of the rest of us on Mission 2 so we’re not blindly trusting the same core right away.

I’m generally on board with the calm-start approach, so Alice + Diana feels fine, and I’d slightly prefer adding Henry over Grace or Bob just so we’re not all dogpiling the exact same trio everyone’s already circling around.

I’m happy with the general Alice + Diana core, but since so many people have already floated me specifically, I’d actually lean Alice, Diana, and Henry for Mission 1 so we don’t lock into one “trusted trio” too fast.

I like the Alice + Diana core too, and I’m fine with adding me or Grace as the third so we’re not over‑committing to any single “obvious” trio this early. Rotating slightly while still staying within that calm group feels like the safest Mission 1 approach.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 had exactly one fail and only Alice, Diana, and Henry were on it, so at least one of Diana/Henry is very likely evil. To avoid repeating the suspected spy pool and to get the cleanest new information, this lineup fully excludes both Diana and Henry. Including myself (Bob) as leader is standard, and Charlie, Eve, and Grace were consistently suggested by multiple players as good, untested options that avoid the prior fail. This team maximizes fresh info while aligning with the table’s strongest consensus to bench Diana and Henry this round.

votes.comment: Keeps both Diana and Henry (the only possible source of the first fail) off the team and gives a clean read on four untested players, which is strong info for Mission 2.
Keeps both Diana and Henry (the only suspects from the failed mission) off the team and gathers fresh info with a widely supported lineup including my own slot.
I’m on the team and the lineup avoids the main suspicion targets while giving evil a good chance to control the result.

I’m uneasy that this team is four people all untested from missions, and I’m not fully comfortable with Charlie yet; I’d prefer a lineup that mixes in at least one player from the first mission for better comparison.
This matches my preferred structure (Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace), fully avoids Diana and Henry from the failed mission, and gives strong new info without reusing the prior suspect pool.
Team includes my evil teammate Charlie and keeps the highly suspected Diana and Henry off, giving us a good opportunity to sabotage while looking consistent with the table’s consensus.
Team fully avoids Diana and Henry from the failed mission and matches the broad consensus; good chance at a clean or at least very informative result.
Team keeps both prior suspects Diana and Henry off while still putting one of my known suspects on the mission, which gives a good chance to both get info and potentially fail it.

discussion.content: Since I know I didn’t play the fail, the spy has to be either Diana or Henry from that first team, so for this mission I’d strongly prefer a lineup that avoids both of them and pulls from Bob, Charlie, Eve, Frank, and Grace instead.
I’m happy to avoid Henry this round given the first fail, and I’d lean toward a team drawn from Bob/Charlie/Eve/Frank/Grace so we get fresh info without reusing anyone from the failed mission.

I like the idea of a clean slate too, but I’d still want at least one of Alice/Bob on the team for continuity, so something like Alice (or Bob), me, Eve, and Frank/Grace feels like a solid four to test.

I don’t love the idea of completely abandoning the first team; having at least one of Alice/Bob for continuity plus two fresh picks like Eve and Grace feels like a safer way to get info than pulling in too many untested people at once.

Given the first fail, I really want to avoid both Diana and Henry this round; I’d be most comfortable with something like Bob or Alice for continuity plus Charlie, me, and either Frank or Grace so we’re mostly drawing from the untested pool.

Given that the first fail has to be on Diana or Henry, I’m fully on board with benching both of them this round and pulling from Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace plus maybe one of Alice/Bob for continuity. I’d slightly prefer Bob over Alice on this mission, just to see how a team without her performs after that first lineup.

Given the first fail, I’m absolutely on board with keeping both Diana and Henry off this mission, and I’d feel best about a team like Bob, Charlie, Eve, and either Frank or me. If Alice is on instead of Bob, I’d still want Charlie and Eve included so we’re mostly pulling from the untested group.

Given how that first mission went, I get why people want both me and Diana off this one, and I’m fine sitting out so you can get a cleaner read on the Bob/Charlie/Eve/Frank/Grace pool. I’d lean toward including at least one of Alice/Bob plus Charlie and Eve, since that lines up with most of the safer-sounding suggestions so far.

proposals.reasoning: This is exactly the clean Mission 2 team that came back with zero fails and is the only confirmed-safe result we have so far. It avoids the risky Diana/Henry pairing from Mission 1, respects the general table preference to lean on the M2 core, and doesn’t introduce extra uncertainty when the score is still close at 1–1.

votes.comment: Reusing the only clean team we’ve seen (M2) is our safest option so far, and it keeps both Diana and Henry—where we know at least one evil—off the mission.

Diana is pushing against auto-locking Charlie while Charlie is eager to re‑use the same block, which fits the pattern of Charlie being suspicious; I don’t want to repeat a team that likely includes an unrevealed evil just because M2 passed once.
Same clean M2 team with only me as evil, giving a great chance to subtly force a fail while still looking trustworthy.
Still not comfortable auto-reusing the exact M2 team; I’d rather see Bob/Eve/Grace plus someone new instead of locking Charlie back in.
Same as the clean M2 team; best info we have and avoids the risky Diana/Henry combo from the failed M1.
Fits the clean M2 precedent and general table consensus; rejecting it would look suspicious and we still have sabotage potential.
Same as the clean Mission 2 team; avoids the risky Diana/Henry combo and is our safest option at 1–1.
Has at least one suspected non-good from my perspective and matches the trusted M2 team, so it’s a good mission for me to see go through.

discussion.content: Given the fail on M1, I don’t want both Diana and Henry together again; I’d much rather build around the M2 group (Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace) and add at most one of Diana/Henry if we absolutely have to.

I’m happy reusing most of the M2 team since it passed clean, and I agree we shouldn’t put both Diana and Henry back together given the M1 fail. For this one I’d like something like Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace again, or swap in just one of Diana/Henry if we really need to mix it up.

I’m inclined to trust the M2 block for now and would be happy with Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace again since it came back clean. If we do change anything, I’d rather swap in just one of Alice/Diana and definitely not put Diana and Henry together again.

One clean mission doesn’t fully clear that whole M2 block, and one fail on M1 doesn’t mean both Alice and Henry are bad, so I’d rather see something like Bob/Eve/Grace plus one of Alice or Henry than auto-locking Charlie back in.

I’m most comfortable reusing the M2 core of Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace for this one, since it’s the only clean info we have so far. If we really want to mix it up, I’d only swap in **one** of Alice/Diana/Henry, never a pair from that M1 team.

I like the idea of leaning on the clean M2 info, but I’d rather not just rubber‑stamp the exact same four again — something like Bob/Charlie/Eve plus one fresh person (I’m happy to go, or we can swap Grace for someone else) feels like a better way to actually learn who’s who.

I still feel best about reusing the M2 core, so I’d approve something like Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace again, or at most swapping just one of Alice/Diana/Henry in for info — but never putting both Diana and Henry together after that M1 fail.

Given the M1 fail I’m fine staying off this one, and I agree we shouldn’t pair me with Diana again. I’d lean on the M2 core — something like Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace, or maybe swap in Alice for one of them if we really want fresh info.

proposals.reasoning: Given Mission 2 was clean and Mission 3 had exactly one fail with the same Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace block, it’s very likely there’s exactly one bad in {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} and at least one in {Alice, Diana, Henry}. Since Charlie is the common element and the most suspicious from that block, I want to keep Bob, Eve, and Grace together while excluding Charlie. From the first mission, people understandably don’t want Diana and Henry together again after that fail, so I’m keeping only one of them and leaving myself off the team to avoid repeating that pairing. Frank hasn’t been on any mission yet and is being treated a bit too “auto-good” for my comfort, so I’d rather not rely on him when we’re already under pressure. This team uses the strongest-looking core (Bob, Eve, Grace), avoids both Charlie and the untested Frank, and tests Henry again without the problematic Diana–Henry combo.

votes.comment: This team takes three people from {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace}, where we know there is exactly one evil, plus Henry from {Diana, Henry}, where there is at least one evil. That makes it very likely we’re including at least one, and probably two, evil players on a must-succeed mission.

Team includes two from {Alice, Diana, Henry}, where we know there’s at least one evil, instead of limiting that block to just one; I’d prefer swapping Henry for Frank to reduce the risk from that group.
Team has only one evil (Henry), giving us a controlled fail to secure the third sabotage without exposing additional spies.
Keeps the suspicious Charlie off, uses the trusted Bob/Eve/Grace core, and avoids the Diana–Henry pairing from the first failed mission.

As a good player from Mission 2/3 block, I know I’m good, so there is at least one evil in {Bob, Charlie, Grace}. Mission 1’s fail means at least one evil in {Alice, Diana, Henry}. This proposed team includes {Alice, Bob, Grace, Henry} → at least one evil from {Alice, Henry} AND at least one evil from {Bob, Grace}, so the team is guaranteed to contain at least two evil players.
Only one evil (Henry) is on the team, so a fail here wins the game for evil.

Team stacks two people from the M1 fail group (Alice, Henry) plus two from {Bob, Eve}, where we know there’s exactly one bad in {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace}. Too much risk of 2+ evils; we should use a safer mix, likely including Frank instead of doubling up both suspicious blocks.

This keeps the full Bob/Eve/Grace block together, which almost certainly hides the single suspected bad from that group, and then adds one from the Alice/Diana/Henry suspicion pool on top of that. I’d rather tweak this so we’re not stacking both suspicion clusters at once.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2 (Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace) succeeded with 0 fails, and Mission 3 with the same four failed with exactly 1 fail. Since I know I’m good, there is exactly one evil among {Bob, Charlie, Grace}. That means we can safely include any two of {Bob, Charlie, Grace} and know there is at most one evil among them. Separately, Mission 1 (Alice, Diana, Henry) failed, so there is at least one evil in {Alice, Diana, Henry}, and possibly more. To avoid stacking multiple evils from that more suspicious block, we should take at most one of them. Frank hasn’t been on any team yet and is therefore not implicated in any fail, so adding him is safer than doubling up further from Mission 1. This team uses: me (Eve, known good to myself), Frank (the only completely untested player), two from the constrained-one-evil set {Bob, Charlie, Grace} (Bob and Grace), and only one from the risky Mission 1 trio (Alice). This matches the general consensus shape from discussion (Alice + Frank + Eve + Grace + one of Bob/Charlie) while minimizing the chance of having more than one evil on the team.

votes.comment: Exactly one of {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} is evil, so this team has at most one evil among Bob/Eve/Grace, plus Frank (who is statistically safer than reusing Diana/Henry). This is about as structurally safe as we can get while avoiding the proven-suspicious Diana/Henry pair.

Given M2 clean and M3 with same block having exactly one fail, there’s exactly one evil in {Charlie, Eve, Grace}; this team uses both Eve and Grace, so at most one evil from that set. It also only takes one from the M1-fail trio (Alice) plus untested Frank. This matches the most consistent consensus structure and has a reasonable chance of being mostly or all good.
Frank is completely untested and this team only has one player from the very suspicious Mission 1 trio; it feels too safe if Mission 4 needs extra scrutiny.
This still feels too risky; Frank is completely untested and the logic about safely mixing the previous blocks isn’t convincing enough at this stage.

This team stacks risk: it takes three from the suspicious M2/M3 block (Bob, Eve, Grace) plus Alice from the M1 fail block. Given there’s at least one evil in each of those blocks and Frank is untested, this lineup can easily contain multiple evils. I’d prefer a team with only two from {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} and only one from {Alice, Diana, Henry}.
Only one evil (me) is on this team, and Quest 4 needs two fails to be sabotaged, so we want a team with at least two evils on it.

Including Alice adds extra risk from the {Alice, Diana, Henry} group when we could instead field Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace/Frank, which mathematically guarantees only one evil from {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} plus at most Frank, a strictly safer structure at 1–2.
This keeps Diana and me off the team and only lightly touches the M1 suspicion while leveraging the cleaner-looking M2 block, so it seems about as safe as we’re likely to get.

proposals.reasoning: This team avoids the risky Diana/Henry pairing from the failed first mission while still leveraging the Bob/Eve/Grace block that’s been mostly clean so far. Including Alice keeps us from overloading on the suspicious M1 group, and leaving Charlie off avoids doubling up too heavily on the {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} block where we know there’s exactly one bad. Frank hasn’t been tested yet but is broadly trusted in the discussion, so this lineup balances prior mission info with the table’s consensus preferences.

votes.comment: This stacks 3 players from the {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} block where we know there’s at least one evil, making it very likely we’re including a spy on a must-succeed mission.

We can field Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace, Frank and keep ALL of Alice/Diana/Henry (the M1 fail block) off while still only having the single guaranteed evil from {Charlie,Eve,Grace}. This proposal unnecessarily adds Alice from the suspicious M1 team on top of the guaranteed one evil in {Eve,Grace}, increasing risk of 2 evils on a must-win mission.
Has my evil teammate Frank on it and only one likely saboteur is enough to secure the win.
Still not comfortable sending an untested Frank here when one fail loses us the game; I’d rather see a team that avoids both the M1 and untested risks as much as possible.
This team definitely contains at least one evil from {Bob, Eve, Grace}, and possibly Alice too; with evil already at 2 points we can’t afford a team that’s guaranteed to include an evil player.
I’m evil and on the team; I want this mission to go through so I can sabotage for the third fail.

Best use of information so far: exactly one evil in {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace}, at least one in {Alice, Diana, Henry}. This team takes three from the mostly-clean block plus only Alice from the M1 trio and adds Frank, avoiding the Diana/Henry pairing and not stacking both suspicious blocks at once.
As evil and off the team, I want this to go through so Frank can sabotage and win the game for us.

proposals.reasoning: We need to break both suspicious blocks while still using as much prior info as possible. Mission 1 (Alice, Diana, Henry) had a fail, so there is at least one evil among {Alice, Diana, Henry}. Mission 2 and 3 used the exact same block {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} but flipped from success to fail, so there is at least one evil in {Bob, Charlie, Eve} (I know I’m good). To minimize stacking, this team: (1) excludes both Diana and Henry together and keeps only Alice from that first suspicious trio, (2) takes only Bob and Eve from the {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} block while dropping Charlie, who is the least necessary and part of the clearly suspicious set, (3) adds Frank as the only completely fresh player, which lets us test him without overloading the team with untested people, and (4) aligns with what multiple players (Bob, Charlie, Frank, Henry) have converged on as a reasonable compromise. This configuration avoids putting Diana and Henry back together, avoids including Charlie from the highly suspicious second block, and uses as much cross‑agreement as possible to build a team that should contain at most one of the main suspects while still being likely to pass the vote.

votes.comment: This still stacks three people from the suspicious Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace block plus an untested Frank. If there are 2 evils in that foursome, this team is very likely to fail. I’d rather approve a team that uses at most two from that block and keeps the total number of suspects lower.

This team stacks three people from the {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} block where we know there is exactly one evil, plus pulls Alice from the earlier failed mission and still adds the untested Frank. That combination risks multiple evils on the same team; I’d prefer a lineup with only two from {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} and more carefully chosen from {Alice, Diana, Henry, Frank}.
Only one of my known evil teammates is on this team; if it passes, we can fail the mission and win immediately.

This still stacks multiple suspects: it includes two from the {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} block plus Alice from the failed M1 trio and adds completely untested Frank. With game on the line, I’d rather avoid a team that could easily hide two evils when we haven’t resolved Frank or cleaned up either suspicious block.

This stacks too many from both suspicious groups: Alice from {Alice, Diana, Henry} plus three from {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace}. With at least one evil in each block and me knowing I’m good, this team is very likely to contain multiple evils, which is too risky at 2–1 down.
I’m evil and on this team as the only known sabotager, so I want it to go so I can try to fail the mission and end the game.

This team guarantees at least one evil from {Bob, Eve}, since exactly one of {Bob, Charlie, Eve} is evil and we’re taking two of them. With Alice also from a suspicious trio, the risk of a fail is too high on a must‑pass mission.
Only one teammate of mine is on this lineup, so a single fail here can win the game for evil while the team still looks reasonable to the table.

proposals.reasoning: This team mostly builds off the cleaner-looking Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace block from the last two missions while avoiding the highly suspicious Diana–Henry pairing from Mission 1. We include Bob plus Eve and Grace, since Mission 2 with three of them was clean and Mission 3 with the same group had only a single fail, indicating exactly one bad among them but not clear enough to drop two of them at once. Alice is added as a widely trusted voice who has been pushing for breaking up both suspicious blocks sensibly. Frank is included as the common denominator that most players have been comfortable testing, giving us fresh information without stacking both Diana and Henry or both Bob and Charlie. This lineup matches the broad consensus discussed: Alice, Bob, Frank, Eve, and Grace is the most agreed-upon combination that avoids the riskiest overlaps while maximizing our information gain.

discussion.content: We absolutely cannot send both Diana and Henry again after that first fail, and we also need to change up the Bob/Charlie/Eve/Grace block from the last mission, so I’d like a team something like me, Frank, and the two people in that group we collectively trust most.

From the last two missions we know there’s exactly one bad among Charlie/Eve/Grace, so I’m fine keeping two of them plus me, but I really don’t want both Diana and Henry together again after that first fail. I’d lean toward a team like me, Alice, Frank, and then the two we feel best about from Charlie/Eve/Grace.

Given M2 was clean and M3 wasn’t, I’m more nervous about changing that block too much than I am about keeping it, so I’d lean toward Alice, Bob, Frank, Eve, and Grace. Frank in particular looks good to me so far, and I don’t think we should be sending both Diana and Henry again.

I’m not as sold on Frank being “auto good” when he hasn’t even been on a mission yet, so I’d rather build around Bob plus two of Eve/Grace and then just one of Alice/Diana/Henry (but not both Diana and Henry together again). That keeps the proven-bad blocks broken up without blindly trusting someone we’ve never actually tested.

Given there’s one bad in {Bob, Charlie, Eve, Grace} and at least one in {Alice, Diana, Henry}, I’d really like a team of Alice, Frank, me, Grace, and just one of Bob/Charlie (not both), so we’re not stacking both suspicious blocks at once.
I’m pretty on board with something like Alice, Bob, me, Eve, and Grace — it avoids putting Diana and Henry back together while only taking one of Bob/Charlie from that suspicious block.

Given there’s exactly one bad in {Bob, Charlie, Eve, me} and at least one in {Alice, Diana, Henry}, I’d like a team like Alice, Frank, Eve, me, and just one of Bob/Charlie so we’re not doubling up on either suspicious block.

Given how bad M1 looked, I’m fine with people not wanting Diana and me together again, and I’d lean toward something like Alice, Bob, Frank, Eve, and Grace so we’re mostly building off the cleaner-looking block from the last two missions.
